body:
$!You must tell DVLA if you have blackouts (fainting or syncope).$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence#

Fill in form FEP1 and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘FEP1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 247KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_178630.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

Fill in form FEP1V and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘FEP1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 340KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_185934.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

If your blackouts are brought on by coughing (cough syncope), you also need to fill in form DIZ1V and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘DIZ1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 182KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_4018276.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D


*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have blackouts (fainting or syncope) - download the correct form to let them know
title: Blackouts (syncope) and driving
